articles.author: Carolyn Y. Johnson
articles.title: 5,500-year-old DNA shows syphilis was rooted in the Americas, before Columbus - The Washington Post
articles.description: Analysis of a shin bone found in a rock cave in Colombia suggests the sexually transmitted disease is much older than previously believed.
articles.content: From a 5,500-year-old humanshin bone, scientists have discovered a close cousin of the pathogen that causes syphilis, providing the oldest evidence yet that the disease has ancient roots in the Ameri… [+38 chars]
